Thank you for contacting LegalZoom for your business needs. In regard to your inquiry, LegalZoom can assist you in forming your Corporation and in registering a Copyright. We simplify the process for you by preparing and filing the Articles of Incorporation with your respective Secretary of State, and by drafting customized, state-specific Bylaws & Resolutions for your business, as well as preparing and submitting the Copyright application to the U.S. Copyright Office.
For your reference, general information regarding establishing a Corporation and Copyright registration has been outlined below. If you would like to get specific, detailed information on your personal situation, please contact a Business Formation Specialist at the phone number listed below. By speaking with a Specialist will be able to assist with answering further questions, as well as building a customized package to best benefit your needs.
A Corporation is a state-specific business entity that provides several advantages as a business structure. Corporations are separate and distinct legal entities that provide the people involved in the business with personal liability protection, separating personal assets from business assets. This liability protection shields personal assets from any debts or liabilities that are incurred by the business. A Corporation also provides name exclusivity in the state where it is registered, ensuring that other Corporations cannot use the same business name in the state. Once a Corporation is established, it is able to conduct business, open a bank account, hire employees, and own property.
Copyright registrations typically protect works of original authorship, and may include items such as literary works, musical works and sound recordings, still and motion pictures, artistic and creative works, architectural works, and websites. A registered Copyright allows you to control how the work is reproduced, distributed, and presented publicly, and to enforce against any infringements upon these rights. Multiple works can be included in a single Copyright submission, as long as they are all in the same state of publication, either published or unpublished.

In addition, this membership provides unlimited access to our Legal Forms database, which includes over 100 legal business forms, and one free Copyright registration per month (excluding US Copyright Office filing fees).
